runs.comm: Mpofu runs in and lands a length delivery on middle and leg, and a gentle tap to mid-on begins the innings.
a touch shorter this time from Mpofu, and Simmons stands up tall to punch to Waller at cover point.
runs this time, Mpofu slipping towards Simmons' pads and being flicked down to fine leg.

a good, sharp run ... in the end. Charles called for it after Simmons tapped towards point, but the fielder there was Vusi Sibanda, and his shy only just missed the stumps. Had it hit, Charles was probably a goner.
nudged off the hip, and they take a rather less dramatic single.
shaping ever so gently away from the bat off a length, and Simmons runs the ball down to third man.
he hits a decent length to start, and the ball is played watchfully to mid-on.
Chatara finds enough swing to curve one past Simmons' swinging bat.
good pace from Chatara, who was distinctly medium-paced in the first match. He reaches 132.5kph with this length delivery.
too straight this time, and it's worked off the legs for a couple.
has this kept a shade low? The ball seamed in and died off the track to beat Simmons' cut, Taylor taking it at shin height.
Simmons glides one down to short third man, where it's cleanly stopped. Chatara ends with a slower ball - and it's very slow at just 104.8kph.
Mpofu errs in line, flinging this one down the leg side.
was this another slower one? It certainly looked like it. No pace to work with as the ball is tapped to backward point.
this one definitely was slower, and Charles punches it to mid-on, his head right over the ball.
good lines on this inswinger from Mpofu, but Charles manages to angle the ball wide of mid-on for a single.
Simmons backs away to give himself acres of room, but Mpofu follows him and the damage is kept to a single.
a scything cut bursts through backward point's hands, and races away to the unguarded third man boundary. That was hit fiercely hard.
angled down leg, the ball strikes the pad and Taylor appeals for lbw. It was missing the stumps, however, and he may well have gone some bat on it too.
laced through extra cover! Charles clears the left leg to give this one a real thump. The off side field barely moved.

not this time! Having pinged the cover boundary, Charles looks to launch this into the clear blue sky beyond deep midwicket, but a full length delivery beats his hoick and rattles the stumps. It was a horrid stroke, to be honest, and young Chatara is very pleased with the dismissal.
Chatara is bowling with good rhythm now, and Bravo is half forward in defense to keep out an in-seaming length delivery.
nicely bowled once more, in the channel on or around off stump and Bravo is content to defend.
an attempted bouncer goes awry, and Taylor has to make ground and leap to his left to cut this off. Chatara really bent his back, reaching 135.4kph, but lost his line completely.
that's better. A fullish length on off stump has Bravo defending.

a stunning effort from Waller on the rope! Or is it? Bravo flicked in the air off his pads in characteristically flamboyant fashion, and Waller backpedaled, leaping at the boundary and trying to tap the ball back into play. Alas, his right foot was grounded outside the rope as he did so.
looped up outside off, Bravo defends to cover and looks for a non-existent single.
nudged to leg this time, but again there's no run to be had with the fielder in quickly.
swept, but straight to the man at short fine leg.
swept once more, but the short fine leg fielder is in action again to stop it.
this time Bravo finds the gap, driving a single to long on.
Simmons follows suit, not taking full toll of a low full toss, and driving a single to long on.
will Simmons deal mainly in sixes again? On this evidence, that looks likely! He steps back to make room, and sends the ball sailing over long off with a fluid swing of the bat.
this shot isn't quite so fluent, but the batsmen find a single off the pad.
again Bravo flicks in the air off his pads, but this shot doesn't have nearly as much airtime, and two runs are taken as fine leg runs round.
a length delivery, bowled at 134.3kph, is tapped back down the track. Chatara misses it, so a single is taken.
eased down to long on for one more.

caught at short fine leg off a no-ball! It was the effort ball from Chatara, up at 142.9kph, but he's overstepped! Masakadza had held a sharp catch, too, Simmons having whipped the ball powerfully off his hip. Well, this no-ball call is actually quite marginal, very close indeed, but the call is made and Zimbabwe don't complain. Here comes the free hit ...
a slower ball bouncer is top-edged up and over short fine leg, the ball bouncing just inside the rope.
whipped down to long on, Simmons playing with the spin.
Bravo picks a gap on the leg side.
and again, Simmons nudges with the spin and a single is taken to long on.
a touch too straight from Utseya, and Bravo nudges in front of square leg.
Simmons is content to milk the offspinner, turning this to the right of midwicket.
eased out through square leg, Utseya spearing the ball down at middle and leg.
tossed up outside off. Bravo leans into a full-blooded drive, but ball spins sharply past bat.
this time the batsman thrusts his bat way out in order to cover the spin, but the ball rushes on to take the inside edge and go to square leg.
straighter, and it's punched to wide long on off the back foot.
Bravo leans back and powers his trademark drive through extra cover, but it's hit along the ground rather than in the air, and the cover sweeper keeps them to a single.
floated up wonderfully well, the ball drifting in at the last moment and Simmons digging it out back to the bowler.
a touch quicker this time, and Simmons tucks to leg.
a touch too much width, and the ball is carved out to deep point.
good running keeps the pressure on Zimbabwe's fielders. The ball was played to wide long on, and the call for a second run was made early.
this one rushes on with the arm, and is dabbed defensively to point.
flicked off the toes through square leg.

Simmons lets Mutombodzi's full toss go unpunished, and is content to nudge the ball softly through midwicket. There's a strong wind blowing across the ground, and this one would've hung in the breeze, so perhaps that put him off.
too full, and too straight, and Bravo flicks to square leg again.
Dwayne Bravo must have a really good bat! He swiped across the line at this, one handed, and it really looked as though he'd mistimed this ... but it sailed high and straight for a big six.

well held by Taylor! Bravo attempted to repeat the stroke, but this time went at it a little too hard and send a swirling top edge up in the region of short third man. Taylor immediately set off after it, and timed his dive to perfection to hold the catch. The Zimbabwe captain failed a fitness test before this tour, but he was after this in double quick time!
Barnwell is off the mark straight away, cutting hard out to deep point.
Mushangwe straightens his line, and Barnwell can't get this away.
cut out to point once again.
Simmons taps to cover, looking for a single, but there's none to be had.
this one dipped and gripped! Barnwell's defenses are tested by one that drifted in, dipped, and spun away from him.
well bowled once more, and Barnwell nudges softly to leg.
there's an appeal from bowler and keeper, who think this full delivery has hit pad first, and then bat. But replays confirm it's bat first, and they take a single to mid-on.
Simmons looks to run the ball to third man, but there's a fielder in close.
Simmons aims to leg this time, working the ball through midwicket.
a topspinner is hurled down the leg side. Good take by Taylor.
Barnwell makes room and finds the gap in the cover field.
Barnwell makes room once again, and aims another cut out to deep point.
heaved out into the leg side, and they push hard for a second.

inside edged! Simmons was lining up one of his slog sweeps, but this one took the inside edge rather than the middle of the bat. The short fine leg fielder sprinted after it, but his dive couldn't haul the ball in.
another heave to leg, but along the ground this time and the ball goes through midwicket.
Barnwell makes room and flays a drive through extra cover.
chopped down through cover point.
Simmons turns the ball with the spin into the leg side.

and the field change brings a wicket! Barnwell stepped right away to leg, looking to hammer a cut through the sparse cover field, but Utseya looped the offspinner down straight and true, the ball spinning in to rattle the stumps. Barnwell tried too hard to manufacture something there.
Pollard is off the mark with an uncharacteristically gentle whip into the leg side.
Simmons backs away, but Utseya's response is a little too enthusiastic and he spears the ball down leg.
a slow, low full toss is nudged to midwicket. Again, Simmons lets a bad ball go unpunished.
Simmons skips out this time, but yorks himself and has to dig the ball out to midwicket.
another full toss, but this one is driven to long on.
flicked out to deep midwicket.
a misfield at backward point allows a single.
an attempted slog sweep comes limply off the toe end, but the ball falls safely in the leg side.

Pollard's almost killed Simmons with this stroke! The ball, from Mushangwe, was too short and Pollard rocket back to hammer a pull, the now bullet-like ball flying past Simmons as he ducked for cover at the non-striker's end. Fiercely hit!
he did this so many times yesterday! Simmons bends down low to play his version of the slog sweep, the ball going well in front of square and sailing over wide long on for six.

gone this time! Simmons sliced at this one, but still hit it very hard. The ball flew low towards Ervine at long off, never getting more than fifteen feet off the ground. Ervine sprinted forward and timed his dive really well to pluck the ball out of the air inches from the turf. He gets a big hug from a smiling bowler for his efforts.
slapped back very hard and in the air towards the bowler, who sticks his hand out but can't stop the missile.
driven to long off this time.
this sat up and asked to be hit. Mutombodzi landed this much to wide of off stump, and Pollard bludgeoned it through extra cover off the back foot.
a better delivery is flicked to long on, Pollard playing against the turn.
Mutombodzi appears a little more confident bowling at Sammy, and this one fizzes off a length to take the West Indian captain's splice.
driven back to the bowler, who fields in his follow through.
a full delivery is spanked down the ground, where long on comes round to keep them to a single. Better running might've given them two.
a slow offcutter is chopped out through point.
Pollard really has to reach for this one, another very slow, very wide offcutter. He cue-ends a drive to long off.
ah, so this is Mpofu's plan. He floats another slow offcutter very wide outside off, but it's a little too wide this time.

monstrous. Simply huge. I'm not sure I've ever seen a bigger hit! This was another slower ball, but it was much straighter and Sammy practically set it alight, so hard did he hit the ball. It sailed clear out of the ground, clearing the stands by several metres.
Sammy lines up another massive heave, but this full toss dips on him and he inside-edges to short fine leg.
on a length and quite wide, Pollard driving through cover.
Pollard flicks with the spin to send the ball rolling slowly to the left of short fine leg.
well timed again, but along the ground this time. Sammy leans back and uses his bottom hand to thump this right between long on and midwicket.

Mushangwe throws to the wrong end! Sammy hit to leg, and Pollard wanted two ... but then changed his mind. His captain was already halfway down, but Mushangwe aimed his throw at Brendan Taylor - and in fact over his head. Sammy is given a life.
drilled down to long on.
flung much too far down the leg side, and they take a single to add to the extra as Taylor can't get across to it.
whipped through square leg.
Sammy glances to short fine leg, where the fielder is in quickly to stop the single.

this didn't come off the middle, but still flew over long off for six! Chatara attempted to copy Mpofu's tactic, and drew a mistimed stroke from the batsman ... but the batsman was Kieron Pollard, so it still went for six.
too wide outside off this time, and Pollard leaves the ball alone as it's called wide.
another six, and this one right into the wind! Chatara offered length outside off, and Pollard threw himself into a backfoot punch. Again, not cleanly timed, but he got enough on it.
now a one-bounce four! A rattled Chatara opted for the short ball, but at no great pace and Pollard step back to hammer a pull to deep midwicket.
another short one, and another pull from Pollard, but this one goes to the fielder at midwicket on the bounce.
another short one, but Sammy can't time his own pull, the ball rolling slowly to long on.
such power! Chatara did almost everything right with the final delivery, sending down a low, dipping full toss ... but Pollard still slapped it so hard that a diving long on fielder couldn't stop it.
the carnage continues! Sammy makes room, and smokes a drive in the air to the deep extra cover boundary.

relief for Zimbabwe! Sammy waits in the crease and sets himself to blast this one straight, but slices underneath the ball and long off holds onto a high chance. It's not the wicket Zimbabwe wanted, but right now, it'll do!
Mutombodzi floats down a yorker, Pollard digging the ball out to long off. I say 'digging ... out', but he still hit it pretty hard.
Mutombodzi gets another! Russell didn't bother to give himself a sighter, slog-sweeping his first ball high to midwicket, but straight into the wind. Ervine got under it, and held the catch cleanly.
well bowled. Flat, fast and straight. Pollard hacks it back to the bowler.

Pollard doesn't care which side the breeze is coming from, if you bowl him a full toss at this stage, he's going to go for it. This one flies out of the middle, rending through the strong wind and sailing over the boundary.
that's a decent start! Mpofu slings down an inswinging yorker, at no great pace but aimed right at the toes. Ramdin jabbed down at it, but not quickly enough to protect his stumps.
Narine spoons a drive out to wide long off, and they find a single to put Pollard on strike.

what's going on out there? Pollard hammers the ball to long off, and they push hard for the second ... Zimbabwe can't get their act together quickly enough to effect a run-out at the non-striker's end. But what's this, the umpire has signaled one short. That's very short. Pollard just turned around a good metre away from the crease. That was surely deliberate, so that he could keep the strike. Spirit of cricket, anyone?

full, wide but Pollard slugs it out to deep midwicket. Sibanda is the fielder out there, but he's throwing into the wind so there's time for a second run. Taylor removes the bails as the throw comes in, but Pollard is home.
well bowled! This is brave stuff from Mpofu. He fires this one past Pollard's outside edge, the big man attempted to hammer it out of the ground but unable to get bat on ball.
great finish to the over by Mpofu! He ends with a yorker, Pollard almost swinging himself off his feet but unable to lay bat on it once again.
